Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, incomplete at right, six lines of a letter.
Curator's comments: The handwriting is most probably that of the Scribe of the Tomb Ramose, for whom see J. J. Černy, 'A Community of Workmen at Thebes in the Ramesside Period' (Cairo, 1973), pp. 317-27 and B.G. Davies, 'Who's Who at Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1999), pp. 79-83. R.J. Demarée, Ramesside Ostraca (London, 2002), 35, pl. 135.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136383) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136383)
Exhibition history: 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
